intro: Hieracium orariiforme, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and hairy, alternate leaves. Native to Europe, it has been introduced to other regions and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm and produces numerous small, herbaceous stems. Its reproductive strategy involves wind pollination, and it can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
